programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel S3
programme.desc: Jonathan Ross, Vick Hope, Tom Allen and Sara Cox try to help the contestants win prizes.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Gurdeep Loyal and Pam Brunton. There are great moments from the BBC food archive, including clips from Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd, and drinks expert Olly Smith picks the wines to go with the studio dishes.

programme.title: Nadiya's Everyday Baking (Easy Roasts) S1 (3/6)
programme.desc: «Easy Roasts»Easy roasts from caramelised onion curry to pineapple lamb ribs.

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott visits the home of Scarborough Athletic to celebrate Non-League Day.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S21 (n°3)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Halesowen and Stoke-on-Trent.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt S52
programme.desc: Today the reds and blues are bargain hunting at antiques centre in Cheshire. Eric Knowles is overseeing the proceedings, and experts Ben Cooper and Richard Madley will be helping our teams, who today have some additional shopping challenges. As well as spending £300 in an hour, they must spend at least £75 on one of their items and complete a buying challenge of Eric's choosing. Eric also pays a visit to the Potteries and the World of Wedgwood.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S12 (1/20)
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and her team upcycle teak architraves, fabric and a sewing machine table.

programme.title: Escape to the Country S20 (10/20)
programme.desc: A couple from Surrey want to escape to the Welsh Borders for a quieter pace of life.

programme.title: Garden Rescue S5
programme.desc: To call the Ricketts' back yard in Christchurch, Dorset, a garden is an insult to gardens! It has no plants, no grass and no privacy. It's far from the colourful, private space the family want. But while they hate the garden's wall-to-wall concrete, mum Rebecca, who works in recycling, doesn't want it all going to landfill. So the challenge facing Charlie Dimmock and the Rich brothers is to turn an ugly concrete space into a beautiful, colourful garden that promotes recycling.

programme.title: Wild Isles (Woodland) S1 (2/5)
programme.desc: «Woodland»David Attenborough enters the woods, revealing a host of hidden marvels amongst the trees.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind S17
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions in the celebrity version of the classic quiz where celebrities donate to charity. Eastenders actor Ricky Groves, comedian Harriet Kemsley, Made in Chelsea star Verity Bowditch and writer Bonnie Greer go under the spotlight answering questions on James Bond themes, sloths, Sir David Attenborough and Hattie McDaniel.

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies S2
programme.desc: Ross Kemp presents the high stakes quiz as a team of celebrity TV presenters - Gareth Malone, Stephen Bailey, Mwaka Mudenda and Ore Oduba - take on the Bridge of Lies for their chosen charities. The bridge has 32 potential steps, including 22 truths and 10 lies, and each player must try to cross by answering questions on different subjects. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing, for a chance to take home prize money for their chosen charities.

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel S3
programme.desc: Chris Hoy, Georgia Toffolo, Snoochie Shy and Bez try to help the contestants win big cash.

programme.title: Big Night of Musicals 2023 by the National Lottery
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts a celebration of musical theatre featuring spectacular performances.

programme.title: Casualty (No Regrets) S37 (n°24)
programme.desc: «No Regrets»Dylan fights to bring an abuser to justice.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.
